required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A1c FIT TEST: An Epidemiological Study Correlating Hemoglobin A1c With Results of the Air Force Physical FITness TEST.
clinical_study.official_title: A1c FIT TEST: An Epidemiological Study Correlating Hemoglobin A1c With Results of the Air Force Physical FITness TEST.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the prevalence of pre-diabetes and diabetes among those Air Force personnel who have not passed the Air Force physical fitness test (AFPT) and to evaluate the usefulness of the AFPT as a prescreening tool for these disease processes.

primary_outcome.measure: Do Air Force personnel who fail the Air Force physical fitness test have a higher incidence of pre-diabetes than those who pass the test?
primary_outcome.description: Do Air Force personnel who fail the Air Force physical fitness test have a higher incidence of pre-diabetes than those who pass the test?

secondary_outcome.measure: And for those who fail, do they have higher cardiovascular risks as correlated with fasting lipid panel.
secondary_outcome.description: And for those who fail, do they have higher cardiovascular risks as correlated with fasting lipid panel.

arm_group.arm_group_label: failed and passed physical fitness test
arm_group.description: 520 subjects who have failed their Air Force physical fitness test and 520 volunteers who have passed their physical fitness test both within the last 6 months

study_pop.textblock: Active duty Air Force personnel will be recruited from all male and female patients 18 years or older at the Mike O'Callaghan Federal Hospital. A total of 1040 subjects will be recruited (520 subjects who have failed their Air Force physical fitness test and 520 volunteers who have passed their physical fitness test both within the last 6 months from recruitment into this study).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
- Tricare Insurance Beneficiary (military insurance) receiving care at Nellis AFB
- Over the age of 18 and took their AFPT within the past 1 month.
Exclusion:
- Previous diagnosis of diabetes
- Pregnant or nursing

overall_official.affiliation: Mike O'Callaghan Federal Hospital/Nellis Air Force Base

facility.name: Mike O'Callaghan Federal Hospital/Nellis Air Force Base
